thread.title: US Coast Guard unloads major drug haul in Puerto Rico | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: US Coast Guard unloads major drug haul in Puerto Rico | Daily Mail Online

author: Associated Press
title: US Coast Guard unloads major drug haul in Puerto Rico | Daily Mail Online
text: comments The Coast guard seized 4.2 tons of cocaine in the the largest maritime cocaine bust in the Atlantic in nearly 20 years. Authorities seized the drug from a boat off South America's northeastern coast, the U.S. Coast Guard said Monday. About 4.2 tons of cocaine, with an estimated street value of $125 million, was confiscated from a fishing boat in international waters off Suriname, said Ricardo Castrodad, a spokesman for the U.S. Coast Guard in San Juan. The boat carrying the cocaine was stopped and searched by authorities Feb. 16 during a joint patrol by the crews of the U.S. Coast Guard cutter Joseph Napier and the Coast Guard of Trinidad and Tobago The 4.2 tons cocaine bust is the largestmaritime cocaine bust in the Atlantic since 1999 It was the largest cocaine bust since 1999. Photos provided by the Cast Guard and US Drug Enforcement Agency show stacks of the white substance piled up after seizure. The 70-foot long vessel was stopped and searched by authorities Feb. 16 during a joint patrol by the crews of the U.S. Coast Guard cutter Joseph Napier and the coast guard of Trinidad and Tobago, Castrodad said. The crew of the Napier, which is based in Port Canaveral, Florida, towed the fishing vessel, the Lady Michelle, to St. Vincent and four men on board from Guyana were taken to the U.S. Virgin Islands to face criminal charges.
